snippet: Countries in the program like Britain and France that have many citizens who have traveled to Iraq and Syria will have to allow more American air marshals on flights and step up data sharing.
abstract: Homeland Security Dept tightens rules for air travel requirements on foreign governments citing threat of attacks from ISIS and other groups; countries participating in visa waiver program must now allow more American air marshals on flights to United States and use special passports that contain electronic chips and rely on biometric identifiers.
lead_paragraph: Countries in the program like Britain and France that have many citizens who have traveled to Iraq and Syria will have to allow more American air marshals on flights and step up data sharing.
